00016 // The intention here is to define a template which will convert
00017 // any class into a singleton with the following features:
00018 //
00019 // a) initialized before first use.
00020 // b) thread-safe for const access to the class
00021 // c) non-locking
00022 //
00023 // In order to do this,
00024 // a) Initialize dynamically when used.
00025 // b) Require that all singletons be initialized before main
00026 // is called or any entry point into the shared library is invoked.
00027 // This guarentees no race condition for initialization.
00028 // In debug mode, we assert that no non-const functions are called
00029 // after main is invoked.
00030 //
00031 
00032 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00033 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00034 # pragma once
00035 #endif 
00036 
00037 #include <cassert>
00038 #include <boost/noncopyable.hpp>
00039 #include <boost/serialization/force_include.hpp>
00040 
00041 namespace boost { 
00042 namespace serialization { 
00043 
00045 // Provides a dynamically-initialized (singleton) instance of T in a
00046 // way that avoids LNK1179 on vc6.  See http://tinyurl.com/ljdp8 or
00047 // http://lists.boost.org/Archives/boost/2006/05/105286.php for
00048 // details.
00049 //
00050 
00051 // singletons created by this code are guarenteed to be unique
00052 // within the executable or shared library which creates them.
00053 // This is sufficient and in fact ideal for the serialization library.
00054 // The singleton is created when the module is loaded and destroyed
00055 // when the module is unloaded.
00056 
00057 // This base class has two functions.
00058 
00059 // First it provides a module handle for each singleton indicating
00060 // the executable or shared library in which it was created. This
00061 // turns out to be necessary and sufficient to implement the tables
00062 // used by serialization library.
00063 
00064 // Second, it provides a mechanism to detect when a non-const function
00065 // is called after initialization.
00066 
00067 // make a singleton to lock/unlock all singletons for alteration.
00068 // The intent is that all singletons created/used by this code
00069 // are to be initialized before main is called. A test program
00070 // can lock all the singletons when main is entereed.  This any
00071 // attempt to retieve a mutable instances while locked will
00072 // generate a assertion if compiled for debug.
00073 
00074 class singleton_module  : public boost::noncopyable
00075 {
00076 private:
00077     static bool & get_lock(){
00078         static bool lock = false;
00079         return lock;
00080     }
00081 public:
00082 //    static const void * get_module_handle(){
00083 //        return static_cast<const void *>(get_module_handle);
00084 //    }
00085     static void lock(){
00086         get_lock() = true;
00087     }
00088     static void unlock(){
00089         get_lock() = false;
00090     }
00091     static bool is_locked() {
00092         return get_lock();
00093     }
00094 };
00095 
00096 namespace detail {
00097 
00098 template<class T>
00099 class singleton_wrapper : public T
00100 {
00101 public:
00102     static bool m_is_destroyed;
00103     ~singleton_wrapper(){
00104         m_is_destroyed = true;
00105     }
00106 };
00107 
00108 template<class T>
00109 bool detail::singleton_wrapper<T>::m_is_destroyed = false;
00110 
00111 } // detail
00112 
00113 template <class T>
00114 class singleton : public singleton_module
00115 {
00116 private:
00117     BOOST_DLLEXPORT static T & instance;
00118     // include this to provoke instantiation at pre-execution time
00119     static void use(T const &) {}
00120     BOOST_DLLEXPORT static T & get_instance() {
00121         static detail::singleton_wrapper<T> t;
00122         // refer to instance, causing it to be instantiated (and
00123         // initialized at startup on working compilers)
00124         assert(! detail::singleton_wrapper<T>::m_is_destroyed);
00125         use(instance);
00126         return static_cast<T &>(t);
00127     }
00128 public:
00129     BOOST_DLLEXPORT static T & get_mutable_instance(){
00130         assert(! is_locked());
00131         return get_instance();
00132     }
00133     BOOST_DLLEXPORT static const T & get_const_instance(){
00134         return get_instance();
00135     }
00136     BOOST_DLLEXPORT static bool is_destroyed(){
00137         return detail::singleton_wrapper<T>::m_is_destroyed;
00138     }
00139 };
00140 
00141 template<class T>
00142 BOOST_DLLEXPORT T & singleton<T>::instance = singleton<T>::get_instance();
00143 
00144 } // namespace serialization
00145 } // namespace boost

00147 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SINGLETON_HPP
